response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agencies must provide written response within 3 business days. Written explanation required for any denial of access.
response_requirements.no_response_consequence: File complaint with Kansas Attorney General or bring civil action in district court

fee_structure.notes: No charge typically for requests under 1 hour or 100 pages. Mailing: $0.50 for first 5 pages, $0.25 for additional 5-page increments. Agencies must make reasonable efforts to contact requesters when staff time exceeds 5 hours or estimated cost exceeds $200.

exemptions.description: Records specifically prohibited by federal law or state statute

appeal_process.appeal_authority: Kansas Attorney General or District Court
appeal_process.appeal_description: File complaint with Attorney General's Office at (785) 296-2215 or bring civil action in district court under K.S.A. 45-222.

penalties.civil: Attorney fees available if agency's denial was not in good faith. Court can require defendant to complete open records training.

requester_requirements.specific_format: No specific form required. Submit requests with specific, detailed descriptions and complete contact information.
requester_requirements.notes: No purpose requirement. No residency requirement. Records presumed open unless specific exemption applies.

specific_obligations: Provide written response within 3 business days
Explain any delays in providing records
Cannot place unreasonable burden on production
Contact requesters when staff time exceeds 5 hours or cost exceeds $200

oversight_body.name: Kansas Attorney General's Office
enforcement_powers: Provide guidance on open records matters
Attorney fees and expenses available for violations found

validation_metadata.verification_notes: Parsed from official statutory text file. Response time verified against canonical-values.json (3 business days). 10 of 55 exemptions parsed from statute.
